Thanks so much

Joe

I’ve done some fun projects in the topology optimization space with nTopology and 3D printing. What sort of projects are you working on and how do you see it impacting the FIRST Robotics space?

67 is one team I know that’s making use of it, really cool stuff:

67 - The HOT Team 2023 Reveal Robot Showcase
We use Altair Inspire, which is available free to people with an EDU email. (https://altairuniversity.com/download-of-altair-inspire-student-edition-and-resources-for-students-and-educators/) The time is varying, we are fortunate enough to have close support from both Altair and a mentor who is a retired Altair employee. Inspire is a surprisingly intuitive program, and Altair has some documentation on how to use it (Altair Inspire Video Instructional Series – Altair Inspire Optimization - YouTu…
","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-08-29T18:46:24.866Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":220,"readers_count":219,"score":79.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":505767,"topic_slug":"anyone-working-with-topology-optimization","display_username":"Rich Jr","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/67-the-hot-team-2023-reveal/428675/15","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"67 - The HOT Team 2023 Reveal","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6998,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 271 | Lead Mentor | Fabworks Discount Code: FRC271"},"post_url":"/t/anyone-working-with-topology-optimization/505767/3","custom_user_title":"FRC 271 | Lead Mentor | Fabworks Discount Code: FRC271","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3725763,"name":"","username":"Alex_Y","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/82dd89/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-08-29T18:47:26.134Z","cooked":"

It’s generally not useful for FRC. There’s the obligatory FEA is very hard and not worth your time during a build season, combined with the fact that you often do not know or don’t even get to control the loading conditions, which makes FEA impossible. For parts where you do know your loading conditions, beams are often a better choice which only benefit from 1 single method of pocketing under highly-controlled loads.

I’m just starting out too, so this thread has been super helpful to read through. Thanks for sharing the Altair Inspire link — that looks like a great place to begin experimenting. Curious to see how others balance the time tradeoff between optimizing designs vs. just building with tried-and-true methods during the season.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-08-30T14:08:18.073Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":131,"readers_count":130,"score":41.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":505767,"topic_slug":"anyone-working-with-topology-optimization","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":76933,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_suspended":true,"post_url":"/t/anyone-working-with-topology-optimization/505767/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3726296,"name":"joel truher","username":"truher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truher/{size}/172222_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-30T14:32:06.047Z","cooked":"

I think design optimizers and generators are a great way to get ideas about resolving the load cases you specify. And you can then use the patterns, broadly speaking, in your own work.

For example, for a project last year, I had a thin plate with in-plane bending and a stout mounting on one end: the generator kept deleting much of the material near the mounting and also made it more of a “Y” than a “V”. I realized these are both good choices: the mounting is strong enough that the plate doesn’t need to double it, and indeed the “Y” is just about as stiff with less material.

I didn’t use the generator’s design, just the ideas it pointed out.
